intro: Pancratium tristylum, commonly known as the yellow lantern or sea daffodil, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean and parts of Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has strap-shaped, grass-like leaves and produces showy, lantern-shaped blooms that attract pollinators. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in maritime climates. Pancratium tristylum is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
